page.title: 07Gorran School building
page.content: There has been a village school on the present site since 1880.However, the old school(Anne Treneer's "School House in the Wind")was destroyed by fire in 1967.The new modern school is granite and glass with a flat roof.it is an open-plan design with three classrooms around a central hall,an art area,a kitchen,a library,and a staff room.Outside are playgrounds,a playing field,a swimming pool,lawns and trees,and beyond the surrounding fields we have a view of the sea.At present there 104 pupils,they come from the villages of Gorran and Gorran Haven,and from outlying hamlets and farms.At the age 11 they transfer to the Roseland School a small comprehensive school at Tregony 7 miles away.
